--- In nbwrpg@y..., robertdahl <rdahl@t...> wrote:
> Firedrill snickered as Beachcomber could only smile. He brought his 
hand
> up to the back of his neck joint, and rubbed it gently. He then 
began a
> bit unsure, "Well repairing isn't my speacialty, i'm a scientist." 
He
> then looked up, a bit more perky, "Besides, you don't look like any
> Cybertronian I've ever seen." he adds jokingly.
> 
> Firedrill pondered the question for a bit, as he kneeled against a
> larger rock, folding his arms, as his eyes went through a couple 
years
> of data. "Well, he was present with a few other autobots at my 
creation,
> and he promised my security instructors that I would be okay on this
> field mission. I guess, you could say he's been like an older 
brother to
> me." He turned his gentle eyes to Redhot. "I've been through a lot 
with
> Beachcomber and Cliffjumper." he said, motioning his head towards
> Beachcomber to show he was there.


    ::REDHOT::

    The red seeker chuckled at his companions' comments.
    "No problem Beachcomber." he said cheerfully. "I apreciate your 
help nevertheless. The reason I look so weird internally is that...." 
he paused, trying to find the right words. "It was an experiment."
    He looked out into the sky, admiring the view. He pulled himself 
away from the beauty of the colours to stare into Firedrills optics.
    "You're lucky." he said sadly. "You can remember your creation."



Northlight
Domnijoe Productions
